<<<api>>>: Hibernate
<<<code>>>: You can use the @OrderBy annotation to sort the results by a specific column and the @Fetch(FetchMode.JOIN) annotation to fetch the related activities in a separate query. Then you can use the ResultTransformer to only return the latest 5 activities.

Example:
```
@OneToMany(cascade = CascadeType.ALL, fetch = FetchType.LAZY, mappedBy = "person", orphanRemoval = true)
@OrderBy("timestamp DESC")
@Fetch(FetchMode.JOIN)
private List<Activity> activities = new ArrayList<>();

public List<Activity> getActivities() {
    return activities;
}

public void setActivities(List<Activity> activities) {
    this.activities = activities;
}
```
Answer:
